page.title: 17Travelling in Stoke
page.content: Stoke has many forms of transport. From Stoke Station we can catch trains to Manchester,Birmingham and London.The railway line is important especially for football supporters coming to the Victoria Ground. About seven years ago a new road system was built,the A500.This road, also called the 'D' road and the Queensway goes through the Potteries.At Hanford there are lots of roads which cross each other.From here we can get onto the M6.These roads are a great advantage to the factories. A long time ago the factories were dependent on the canals to transport their goods.Today the Trent and Mersey Canal which passes through our area is used by pleasure craft. The River Trent is very good for fishing in!It's a pity that it is a little polluted by litter.
